basics.name: Dustin Hlava
basics.label: Front-End Web Developer
basics.summary: My name is Dustin Hlava and I am a front-end web developer in Austin, TX. I have a passion for writing clean, fast, and efficient HTML, CSS, and JavaScript using modern web programming techniques and tools. I have designed, developed, and deployed numerous large web sites and applications. While my passions lie in front-end development, I have developed a broad web technology skill set which I am always eager to grow.

work.name: United Airlines
work.position: Senior Web UI Developer/Manger of Web App. UI Development
highlights: Architected, developed, and launched the next-generation United.com
Established front-end architecture and coding standards across United’s ecommerce applications
Engineered and developed (full-stack) numerous large, high-impact products and feature enhancements to United’s ecommerce applications
Worked side-by-side with team members in various company roles (leadership, business development, design, marketing, testing) to design and refine the application user experience

Responsible for the remediation of United.com to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 AA guidelines and was a team recipient of the 2017 Access Award by the American Foundation for the Blind
Successfully fostered the transformation of United eCommerce software development from traditional waterfall to agile using extreme programming methodologies
Implemented and maintained automated continuous delivery servers (GoCD and TeamCity) to enable continuous integration and continuous delivery of new United.com products and features
Practiced test-driven development (TDD) and integrated multiple levels of the testing pyramid (unit tests, integration, functional/UI) into the United.com continuous delivery pipelines

work.name: Hartigen Solutions, LLC
highlights: Functioned as a lead front-end developer for a startup North American power market web application
Designed and developed client-side application code using multiple JavaScript frameworks and tools such as ExtJS, jQuery, and Backbone.js
Implemented real-time web application behaviors using various HTML5 APIs such as WebSockets
Developed using the latest and greatest CSS and JavaScript features while falling back gracefully in less capable browsers
Worked directly and effectively with team members in all other company roles (leadership, sales, design, testing) to design and refine the application user experience

projects.name: Arrow Electronics
projects.description: While an employee of the User Interface team at Arrow Electronics, a Fortune 200 distribution company, I provided critical front-end web development for their North American and global eCommerce platforms. Over my two years at Arrow, I was part of a team that successfully launched five large, complex web applications, relaunched all previously existing eCommerce applications, and developed Arrow's core UI/UX guidelines based on web standards, performance optimization, and usability.

projects.name: Purdue Manurfacturing Extension Partnership
projects.description: After a period of substantial growth, the Purdue MEP had outgrown their previous web presence as a section on Technical Assistance Programs web site and needed an independent site to share their services, economic impact, client success stories, and upcoming events. Important requirements were improved page navigation and real estate, usability, and search engine optimization.

projects.name: Indianapolis Coalition for Patient Safety
projects.description: The Indianapolis Coalition for Patient Safety is a non-profit partnership of health care leaders committed to advancing patient safety. As a replacement for their previous site, IndyPatientSafety.org features and improved layout and content design as well as new functionality. Logged in members gain access to tools such as a document sharing library, member administration pages, and a member address book.

projects.name: Indiana Pharmacy Compare
projects.description: The Indiana Pharmacy Compare web site, a collaboration between Purdue University and the Pharmacy Quality Alliance, is one of five nationwide projects developed to deliver secured performance reports for participating pharmacies. These pharmacies could access their reports to see scores for a list of performance measures as well as how those scores compared to other pharmacies in the same area.

projects.name: Purdue Center for Regional Development
projects.description: The Purdue Center for Regional Development needed an update to their previous web site. The main requirements for this site was a new professional design, improved site structure and navigation optimization so users could easy find the content they were looking for.

projects.name: Hoosier Heartland Small Business Development Center
projects.description: For their first time on the web, the Hoosier Heartland Small Business Development Center needed a site to provide potential clients with a list of services, success stories, upcoming events, and an easy way to contact the HHSBDC.

projects.name: Quality Environmental Professionals Inc.
projects.description: As part of their overall marketing redesign initiative, QEPI wanted a fresh look for their web site. The updated site needed a clean, professional look as well as improvements to site structure and organization.

projects.name: Egg of the Apocalypse: The Big Eye Bill Chronicles
projects.description: Bill, a crime fighting egg with a giant eye, must stop the evil villain banana, Chiquito, from robbing the city's largest bank. This short 3D animation, a collaboration between myself, John Wojtowicz, and Carlos Urquieta, was created using numerous graphic software packages such as Autodesk Maya, Adobe Photoshop, as well as other software in the Adobe Creative Suite. Egg of the Apocalypse received two awards: "1st Place Animation" in the 2006 Purdue Digital Cinema Contest and the "Most Entertaining" award in the 2006 Spring Show of the Purdue SIGGRAPH chapter.

projects.name: The Travels of Bob the Bacterium
projects.description: The Travels of Bob the Bacterium is one part in a series of educational stories used to teach Indiana's elementary school students about agricultural concepts. In collaboration with the Purdue Agronomy Department and the other members of my senior project group at Purdue University, the story of Bob the Bacterium was transformed from its original printed format to an interactive 3D animation.

projects.name: X-wing Rendering
projects.description: The goal was to take any movie and recreate a single frame from that movie using 3D modeling and rendering techniques. I think you can guess which movie this is from.

projects.name: Nintendo Illustration
projects.description: A photo-realistic vector illustration of the classic Nintendo Entertainment System.
